input: Euler's formula about e to the i pi, explained with velocities to positions.
translatedText: 关于 e 到 i pi 的欧拉公式，用速度到位置进行解释。

input: An equally valuable form of support is to simply share some of the videos.
translatedText: 另一种同样有价值的支持形式是分享一些视频。

input: Special thanks to these supporters: https://www.3blue1brown.com
Not familiar with the calculus referenced in this video?  Try taking a look at this one:
translatedText: 不熟悉该视频中引用的微积分？尝试看一下这个：

input: Another perspective on this formula, from Mathologer:
translatedText: Mathologer 对这个公式的另一种看法：

input: And yet another from the blog Better Explained:
translatedText: 还有另一个来自博客“更好的解释”：

input: I'm not sure where the perspective shown in this video originates.  I do know you can find it in Tristan Needham's excellent book "Visual Complex Analysis", but if anyone has a sense of the first occurrence of this intuition do feel free to share.  It's simple and natural enough, though, that it's probably a view which has been independently thought up many times over.
translatedText: 我不确定该视频中显示的视角源自何处。我知道你可以在 Tristan Needham 的优秀著作《视觉复杂分析》中找到它，但如果有人第一次感受到这种直觉，请随时分享。然而，它足够简单和自然，以至于它可能是一个经过多次独立思考的观点。
